info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 17 at 10:33AM CDT until October 17 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE DANGER THIS AFTERNOON... .Strong northwest wind, low relative humidity, and low fuel moisture will lead to critical fire danger this afternoon across parts of central and eastern Missouri as well as southwest and south central Illinois. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, STRONG NORTHWEST WIND, AND LOW FUEL MOISTURES ACROSS PARTS OF CENTRAL AND EASTERN MISSOURI AS WELL AS SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH CENTRAL ILLINOIS... The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a Red Flag Warning for critical fire danger, which is in effect until 6 PM CDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...In Illinois, Fire Weather Zones 074, 079 and 102. In Missouri, Fire Weather Zones 047, 048, 049, 059, 062, 065, 072, 073, 074, 075, 083, 084, 085 and 099. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Northwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * TIMING...this afternoon from 100 pm until 600 pm. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 22 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the upper 40s. * LIGHTNING...No lightning is forecast. * 10 HOUR FUELS...Less than 9 percent. * IMPACTS...These conditions are conducive for the rapid spread and growth of uncontrolled wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry fuels can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
